text: More resources are now available for Alabamians as we work to combat the effects of #COVID19! @GovernorKayIvey just launched #ALTogether – a site focused on providing additional information & assistance for those who need it. https://t.co/PosdJTh8Ii

If we want to end this crisis, we must also do everything in our power to stop the spread of the virus. We must control the one thing we can: our own actions. We must all do our part to flatten the curve by following the guidelines from our nation’s leading health officials.
They are facing this catastrophe head-on and prioritizing our collective health and safety over their own. These are the unspoken heroes of the Coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/iaKVorZxow

Amidst this public health and economic crisis, we must remember and salute those who continue to serve our nation. Health care professionals, researchers, policeman, firefighters, truck drivers, grocery store clerks, and other members of society are still out there working hard.

I am confident that this legislation will pave the way for us to overcome the current economic and public health crisis we are facing, allowing us to emerge stronger on the other side. https://t.co/FwRKxUWScB

Relief is finally coming to the American people! Tonight, the Senate passed legislation that will provide $2 trillion in funding to provide for those in need during this mounting emergency. Glad we have finally been able to advance these resources and help protect our people.
I urge my colleagues to unify and support this legislation without reservation. We must get this package to  @POTUS's desk expeditiously. There is no time to waste. https://t.co/JStWdDJDrp
States and localities facing this head-on are in desperate need of federal support. Delivering these resources and providing relief is our responsibility.
A crisis of this magnitude demands bold action and considerable resources, and that’s what we’re working to provide for American families, workers, and businesses in this bipartisan package.

Proud we're finally closer to addressing this urgent matter. The #CARESAct contains $340B in emergency supplemental funding for those suffering due to this crisis. More than 80% of total funds in the #appropriations division will go directly to state & local govts & communities.

RT @senatemajldr: At last, we have a deal.
 
After days of intense discussions, the Senate has reached a bipartisan agreement on a historic…

The American people need our help in the midst of this emergency. I urge my colleagues across the aisle to help us agree on a comprehensive package so we can provide critical resources for those in need during this time of unease throughout our nation. Time is of the essence.

Some good news in the midst of the COVID-19 crisis: @DeptofDefense just reported a successful test of a hypersonic glide body, which paves the way for these to be built in #AL. These weapons will modernize our Armed Forces & improve our national defense. https://t.co/wGhPuoRubR

Another portion of the comprehensive CARES Act is the Keeping Workers Paid & Employed Act – a vital measure to protect our nation's small businesses. This $300B relief plan will help small businesses impacted by the Coronavirus pandemic make it through this crisis. #SmallBiz https://t.co/ogNGa1NLLz

Instead, we are allowing the Treasury Secretary to make or guarantee collateralized loans to industries whose operations the Coronavirus outbreak has jeopardized. In my judgment, this approach strikes an appropriate balance between providing assistance and protecting taxpayers.

American businesses didn’t cause this crisis & aggressive action is warranted to ensure they have the liquidity necessary to weather its direct impacts. But let’s be crystal clear about what we are & are not doing here. We're not bailing out airlines or other industries - period.

Today I worked with my Senate colleagues to unveil a comprehensive economic response package to the COVID-19 outbreak – specifically legislation involving liquidity assistance for distressed American industries. https://t.co/F3tU0whHhj

It is my hope that in the coming days, we can pass an additional package that will contain comprehensive funding and protections to mitigate this virus and safeguard small businesses and others that make up the economic foundation of our nation. https://t.co/IPFAwyQuhl

During this unprecedented time, the Senate has been able to advance another agreement to help combat this deadly disease. Although my colleagues and I still have urgent work to do, this is a step in the right direction.

The Senate remains in session this week working to pass monumental legislation to combat the Coronavirus & help the American people. In the meantime, please visit my website for helpful information & resources related to COVID-19: https://t.co/w8nilIG10p

I urge everyone to be safe and practice the @CDCgov-recommended protocols. The Senate will continue to work next week on additional bipartisan legislation to combat the Coronavirus and protect our economy. Our top priority is the health and safety of the American people.

Good news! Today Anna Manasco was favorably reported out of the @SenJudiciary Committee by an overwhelming majority. She is immensely qualified to be a District Judge for the Northern District of #AL, & I strongly urge my colleagues to support her nomination on the Senate floor.

Today I spoke to @POTUS about a possible economic stimulus package and the payroll tax. I suggested we also consider a huge infrastructure package, which the American economy needs. Appreciated him attending our @SenateGOP lunch today.

Enjoyed visiting with a bright group of #MontgomeryAcademy students on the Senate steps today during their trip to Washington. Appreciate them stopping by to say hello! @MAEagles https://t.co/NtVbpXVUYt
Thank you @NIHDirector for visiting @UABNews! Proud he was able to see firsthand all the biomedical research occurring in #Alabama. https://t.co/iXhoskVWQu

Addressed the @AL_League this morning during their annual visit to Washington. Enjoyed speaking to them about our work here and how it can impact various cities across the state. Proud of all they are accomplishing in #AL! @LeagueofCities https://t.co/kibpufXZ3D

The package will now go to the President’s desk for his signature. Thank you to my colleagues for the support and cooperation. We are doing our jobs to protect the American people from a deadly disease. https://t.co/o7gkEW4Vzx

Pleased the Senate voted today to pass the #Coronavirus emergency supplemental package by a vote of 96-1, directing $8.3B in total resources to combat the virus at the local, state, federal, and international levels amidst this urgent crisis.

Chaired a #defense approps hearing to review the FY2021 budget request for @USNationalGuard. Appreciated updates on the modernization of our forces as @DeptofDefense has shifted to prepare, deter, & if necessary, fight future conflict against adversaries. https://t.co/VLaHymG5ui
We face this crisis together; we are fighting it together. Ultimately, I believe we will prevail together. But now is the time for action. https://t.co/x0TKjVnr0N

.@VP Pence has been very helpful in this effort, and I appreciate @POTUS’s eagerness to sign this legislation. I also want to thank @SenateMajLdr, @SenSchumer, @SenLeahy, @NitaLowey, and @RepKayGranger for coming together to do the right thing for the American people.
The legislation contains funding to combat the spread of the virus at the local, state, national, and international levels – allowing for necessary precautions, prevention, and treatment.

Today we came to an agreement on a $7.767B Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Package to combat the #Coronavirus. We worked together to craft an aggressive and comprehensive response that provides the resources the experts say they need to combat this crisis.

Delivering remarks shortly on the Senate floor regarding the $7.767 billion #Coronavirus Emergency Supplemental. Tune in! This shouldn't be about politics; this is about doing our job to protect the American people. I urge my colleagues to support the package without delay.

Great news from @Outdoor_Alabama: This year’s #redsnapper season will open May 22 for private anglers and will include four-day weekends, allowing fishermen more time on the water. Looking forward to another prosperous season for AL’s Gulf Coast fisheries. https://t.co/IU9pQW11sT

Proud to introduce legislation in the Senate to designate Alabama’s Black Belt region as a National Heritage Area, which would promote tourism & increase public awareness of the natural, historical, and cultural assets our state has to offer: https://t.co/eEq8OPGu9Q

Incredible that @UABnews has developed a drug used to treat select patients infected with the Coronavirus - both in the US and in China. This potential treatment is the result of research occurring in Alabama & could help save thousands around the world. https://t.co/glyQ2JqtKi

As a pro-life advocate, I voted today to advance the Pain-Capable Unborn Child Protection Act and the Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act. These bills are an important step in defending innocent human lives.

I just got off the phone with the President. He told me that his administration will not be sending any victims of the Coronavirus from the Diamond Princess cruise ship to Anniston, Alabama. Thank you, @POTUS, for working with us to ensure the safety of all Alabamians.

Grateful to the Army Corps of Engineers for allocating the full federal share of the project cost and to the state of Alabama for providing the required matching funds. I look forward to its completion and the resulting impact. https://t.co/YbOZqlYyQq
The completion of this transformative project is expected to stem immeasurable economic growth and will position Alabama & the #GulfCoast region for success for generations to come.

Today marks a historic moment & victory for #Mobile & the entire state of #Alabama! @USACEHQ has allocated $274.3 million to complete the Port of Mobile project. Over the last decade, I have been advocating for the deepening & widening of the Port of Mobile. @AlabamaPortAuth

Today I joined the majority of my Senate colleagues in justly voting to acquit @POTUS of both impeachment charges. The House managers’ case was nothing more than an abuse of the power of impeachment itself.

I look forward to continuing on this path to success paved by @realDonaldTrump. https://t.co/oa49evDPC5

.@POTUS’s address to Congress was an encouraging reminder of all we have accomplished throughout his time in office. From fostering a thriving economy & generating jobs to building a robust military & protecting national security interests, we have experienced tremendous growth.

This evening, a majority of the Senate joined me in voting against subpoenaing new witnesses. The President’s actions, as presented by the House in the two articles, do not constitute an impeachable offense. https://t.co/5lI4EC4KTT
It's evident to me that @POTUS's actions are not worthy of removal from office, & I do not believe additional evidence would prove otherwise.

Throughout the impeachment proceedings in the Senate, I've carefully listened to arguments from both the House managers & the President's counsel to fairly evaluate whether or not @POTUS's actions meet the Constitution’s high bar for an impeachable offense.

Today I joined a resolution with 26 of my colleagues condemning the House of Representatives for withholding the Articles of Impeachment. The speaker’s actions are currently inconsistent with the Constitution. @POTUS and the American people deserve better. https://t.co/xriI3OaP9c

We must be vigilant following Iran’s attack on US troops in Iraq. Our Armed Forces are the most powerful in the world, and I remain confident that the President will do what it takes to protect and defend our nation. (2/2)

I believe that President Trump was very presidential and showed leadership and purpose. I support the President’s effort to negotiate with Iran from a position of strength and his vow to retaliate with military action if Americans or American assets are harmed. (1/2)
